docs.snippet: In a story April 28 about the arrest of Paul Simon and Edie Brickell, The Associated Press, relying on information from police, erroneously reported Brickell's age. She is 48, not 47....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story April 28 about the arrest of Paul Simon and Edie Brickell, The Associated Press, relying on information from police, erroneously reported Brickell's age. She is 48, not 47.

docs.snippet: The Clippers players turned their jerseys inside out during a practice. You wonder, in years to come, if these proud men and splendid athletes will think that was enough of a response....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Clippers players turned their jerseys inside out during a practice. You wonder, in years to come, if these proud men and splendid athletes will think that was enough of a response.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Sports of The Times column questions whether decision by Los Angeles Clippers players to turn their practice jerseys inside-out before playoff game against Golden State Warriors was enough of a protest against team owner Donald Sterling; he is reported to have made highly racist comments in audio recording.

headline.main: Given Cause to Make a Stand, the Clippers Settle for a Gesture
headline.print_headline: Given Cause to Make a Stand, a Team Settles for a Gesture

docs.snippet: A fierce tornado that swept through Arkansas killed more than a dozen people, including two sisters and their father, part of a large family that had gathered for a "normal" evening before the storm drove them to seek shelter under a staircase....
docs.lead_paragraph: A fierce tornado that swept through Arkansas killed more than a dozen people, including two sisters and their father, part of a large family that had gathered for a "normal" evening before the storm drove them to seek shelter under a staircase.

headline.main: Profiles of Those Killed by Arkansas Tornado
headline.print_headline: Profiles of Those Killed by Arkansas Tornado

docs.snippet: President Park Geun-hye accepted the resignation of Prime Minister Chung Hong-won but asked him to stay in his post until the government completed its rescue operations, an official said....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Park Geun-hye accepted the resignation of Prime Minister Chung Hong-won but asked him to stay in his post until the government completed its rescue operations, an official said.

headline.main: South Korean Leader Accepts Resignation of Premier Over Ferry Disaster

docs.snippet: Sharks forward Joe Pavelski has been under the radar for several years, but this season has been quite different....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sharks forward Joe Pavelski has been under the radar for several years, but this season has been quite different.
docs.abstract: Profile of San Jose Sharks forward Joe Pavelski, who led the team in points during the regular season, finishing with a career-best 41 goals; Pavelski is busy preparing with the team for Game 6 of first-round playoff series against Los Angeles Kings, in which the Sharks lead, 3-2.

headline.seo: More Goals Bring More Attention to Sharks’ Joe Pavelski
headline.main: A Versatile Shark Quietly Makes a Major Difference
headline.print_headline: A Versatile Shark Quietly Makes a Major Difference

docs.snippet: The United States imposed new sanctions on allies of Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday, prompting Moscow to denounce "Cold War" tactics amid more violence in eastern Ukraine....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States imposed new sanctions on allies of Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday, prompting Moscow to denounce "Cold War" tactics amid more violence in eastern Ukraine.

headline.main: U.S. Sanctions Putin Allies as Ukraine Violence Goes On
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sanctions Putin Allies as Ukraine Violence Goes On

docs.snippet: Friends close to the 16-year-old accused of fatally stabbing a fellow high school student sifted through clues, saying he had seemed detached and in need of help....
docs.lead_paragraph: Friends close to the 16-year-old accused of fatally stabbing a fellow high school student sifted through clues, saying he had seemed detached and in need of help.
docs.abstract: Classmates of Chris Plaskon, accused of stabbing to death longtime friend Maren Sanchez in hallway of Jonathan Law High School in Milford, Conn, say they suspected he suffered from mental illness and recall that he seemed more detached than usual before the incident.

headline.main: Suspect in School Attack Once Turned to Victim for Help, Friends Say
headline.print_headline: Suspect in School Attack Once Turned to Victim for Help, Friends Say

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and NATE SCHWEBER
